Yes, and that's quite aside from the fact that there are vast swaths of Python, Ruby, and Smalltalk where all methods are public. I think that we, myself included, often forget that protection has a very large cultural component. Do something in Ruby or Python and it feels right, do the same thing in Java or C++ and it feels wrong.Michael Featherswww.objectmentor.comDavid Saff wrote:>Ole,>>It has been proposed in the past--I can't seem to find it on Google,>but I have a memory of Ron Jeffries quoting someone else who had done>a small experiment of making all methods public and still having a>sensible API, and had liked the results.>>I myself am not tempted to go to this extreme.
